item.description:
Another great hike suggested by Trisha; Mt Cardigan. I think it sounded awesome and very doable.

Cardigan state park spans 5,655 acres, the 3,121- foot treeless granite summit offers great views of NH, VT and even Maine.

I've got to get a few more details from Trisha as to the trail we may take, but I believe it will not be more than a 3 mile total hike ( round trip) I think for this adventure we will all need to bring a lunch and lots of water and treats for the dogs.
I will keep you updated on more details as I find out more.



Looks like the West Ridge Trail would be the easiest for us and the puppies checkout this review of the trails available

Get the Mount Cardigan Trail Map

DIRECTIONS:
VIA TRAILHEADS AT CARDIGAN STATE PARK: From I-89. Get off of exit 17 and head east on Route 4 towards Enfield and Canaan. Once in Canaan make a left onto Route 118 towards Orange and Rumney. At roughly a half mile north of Canaan make a right at the Cardigan State Park sign. Bear right after crossing over a stream roughly two and a half miles. The road to the parking area will be on your left, roughly a mile past the creek (closed in winter and early spring).
item.how_to_find_us: Green Volvo Wagon with EPRINT plates

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Mt Cardigan
